definition[0]: when you calculate how much risk there is of not being paid if you supply a company in a foreign country with goods or services
definition[1]: when a bank calculates how much risk there is of not being paid if it makes a loan to a foreign country
example[0]: Despite the use of country risk analysis, it must be admitted that competition for loan business has sometimes encouraged banks to indulge in unwise lending.
definition[2]: when a check is made on a factory to see that it is operating safely
example[1]: The plant, which treats hazardous wastes, had a risk analysis carried out last year in response to public concern.
